MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: What is the main objective of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To classify data based on models developed | b: To predict future outcomes based on models | c: Both a and b | d: None of the above

MCQ: Which field focuses on exploratory data analysis through unsupervised learning?
Choices: a: Machine learning | b: Data mining | c: Natural language processing | d: Computer vision

MCQ: Who introduced a theoretical neural structure formed by interactions among nerve cells in 1949?
Choices: a: Arthur Samuel | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Donald Hebb | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: Which company developed an experimental 'learning machine' called Cybertron in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: IBM | b: Raytheon Company | c: Microsoft | d: Apple
